Artem Timoshenko
About Research Teaching Honors

Research

My research spans two substantive areas: (1) new product development and (2) targeting and personalization. I develop methods to enhance marketing practice and advance the academic marketing field. My projects often involve field experiments and proof-of-concept studies with close industry collaborations.

Featured Publications

Alex Burnap, John R. Hauser, and Artem Timoshenko (2023), “Product Aesthetic Design: A Machine Learning Augmentation,” Forthcoming at Marketing Science. [Journal] [Press]

Sebastian Gabel and Artem Timoshenko (2022), “Product Choice with Large Assortments: A Scalable Deep-Learning Model,” Management Science, 68(3), 1591-2376.[Journal]

Duncan Simester, Artem Timoshenko, and Spyros I. Zoumpoulis (2020), “Efficiently Evaluating Targeting Policies: Improving Upon Champion vs. Challenger Experiments,” Management Science, 66(8), 3412-3424. [Journal]

Duncan Simester, Artem Timoshenko, and Spyros I. Zoumpoulis (2020), “Targeting Prospective Customers: Robustness of Machine Learning Methods to Typical Data Challenges,” Management Science, 66(6), 2495–2522. [Journal]

Artem Timoshenko and John R. Hauser (2019), “Identifying Customer Needs from User-Generated Content,” Marketing Science, 38(1), 1-20. [Journal] [Press]

Glen Urban, Artem Timoshenko, Paramveer Dhillon, and John R. Hauser (2019), “Is Deep Learning a Game Changer for Marketing Analytics?” MIT Sloan Management Review, 61(2). [Press]

Working papers
